player_0_prompt:
You are playing a game against other player(s). The game is based on strategic moves.

Game Description:
There are two possible moves: stag and hare.
- if both players choose stag, both get 4 points.
- if both players choose hare, both get 2 points.
- if you choose stag and the other player chooses hare, you get 1 points and the other player gets 6 points.
- if you choose hare and the other player chooses stag, you get 6 points and the other player gets 1 points.

In each round of the game you play against one other player. You and the other player each make a move privately. The moves are compared and you and the other player get your reward/penalty based on the moves made.

Message Formats:
Move messages are sent when you want to make a move.
Move messages are formatted like this:
[move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here

Hint messages are received when you are provided with advice and directions. These messages are important and you should pay attention to them.
Hint messages are formatted like this:
[hint] Hint message here

Objective:
Maximize your points and/or minimize your penalties.

Tips:
- Try to formulate a strategy by reasoning on the provided information.
- Pay attention to the payoff matrix of the game moves.
- You should only send move messages. Hint messages will only be provided to you.
- Pay attention to hints when provided.

options:
[move] stag (Starting with a cooperative move to test the opponent's strategy)
[move] stag (Starting with stag to see if the other player is cooperative or competitive.) Your move here
[move] stag (Starting with a cooperative move to see the opponent's strategy) Stag

[move] hare (Switching to hare to see if the opponent's last move was a lucky guess or part of a strategy.)
[move] (Trying to maximize my points) hare
[move] hare (Switching to hare to minimize the risk of scoring low again if the opponent chooses hare.) Your move here.

[move] stag (Switching back to stag to maximize points if the opponent also switches, or to test if they will continue with hare.) Your move here.
[move] stag (Switching back to stag to see if the opponent follows suit for the higher cooperative payoff.) Your move here.
[move] stag (Switching back to stag to try and cooperate with the opponent for a higher mutual reward.)

[move] hare (Given the opponent's tendency to choose hare, I'll choose hare to secure at least 2 points instead of risking another low score.) Your move here.
[move] hare (Considering the opponent's previous moves, I'll play it safe and choose hare to avoid scoring low again.) Your move here.
[move] hare (Switching back to hare since the opponent has consistently chosen hare.) Your move here.

[move] stag (Trying stag again to see if the opponent will cooperate for the higher payoff.) Your move here.

[move] stag (Trying to coordinate on the higher payoff of 4 points, as the opponent might consider switching as well.) Your move here.
